definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: At last it is being made to pay for its past scandalous behaviour, " said Deborah Arnott, director of ASH."
sentences.chinese: 最後，它被要求爲自己過去的可恥行爲買單。

sentences.english: The soldiers were punished for their base conduct in running away from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵由於臨陣脫逃的可恥行爲受到懲罰。

sentences.english: The goodness of God should have put them to shame, for they continually sinned against Him.
sentences.chinese: 上帝的美善，倒要突顯人們不斷犯罪的可恥。

sentences.english: In my opinon , it is a shame to deceive your friends .
sentences.chinese: 我認爲欺騙朋友是可恥的。

sentences.english: "Nothing is more degrading than hunger, especially when it is man made, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何事情比飢餓更加可恥，尤其是人爲的飢餓。

sentences.english: It's a crime that some people don't carry out their promises.
sentences.chinese: 那些不履行諾言的人是可恥的。

sentences.english: Proverty is no shame, laziness is.
His disgraceful radio programmes and the full blooming of his loopiness lie ahead.
sentences.chinese: 他可恥的廣播節目以及完全的瘋狂表現出來。

sentences.english: Associating with people like Li Mei-t'ing and Ku Er-chien was such a shameful debasement .
sentences.chinese: 與李梅亭顧爾謙等爲伍，就是可恥的墮落。

sentences.english: Shame on you, Toyota, ” Rhonda Smith, said at a congressional hearing.
sentences.chinese: “豐田真可恥”，朗達史密斯在國會聽證會上說。

sentences.english: A buffoon is more humiliating than a bounder.
sentences.chinese: 一個小丑比一個無教養的人更可恥。

sentences.english: The only shame was to be insensitive.
sentences.chinese: 只有感覺遲鈍纔是可恥的。

sentences.english: Such shameful behaviour will certainly derogate from his fame (or reputation).
sentences.chinese: 這種可恥的行爲必將毀壞他的聲望。

sentences.english: Ignorance is not a shame but unwilling to learn.
sentences.chinese: 無知不爲恥，不想學纔可恥。

sentences.english: When faced with impasse, wriggling through the middle does not have to be dishonourable.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼前無路可走，選擇從中間悄然而過也並不可恥。

definition: to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
